legal_basis.deadline_description_en: Must be submitted within 14 days of the qualifying event (losing employer insurance, moving in, birth, etc.)
legal_basis.penalty_en: Late enrollment means you still owe premiums from the eligibility date, and medical costs incurred before enrollment are not covered.
legal_basis.cost_note_en: Free to file. Monthly premiums are billed separately based on income.

documents_required.ja: 健康保険資格喪失証明書
documents_required.en: Certificate of Health Insurance Loss (from former employer)
My Number Card (or My Number notification)
Bank passbook & registered seal (for auto-debit setup)

enroll_after_moving.title_en: Enrolling after moving to a new ward

disenroll_for_job.title_ja: 社会保険加入による脱退

documents_required.ja: 国民健康保険資格確認書

common_mistakes.fix_en: You owe premiums retroactively from the eligibility date, but medical expenses during the gap are not covered.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Forgetting to disenroll from NHI after getting employer insurance
common_mistakes.fix_en: You will be double-billed for premiums. NHI does not automatically cancel.

common_mistakes.mistake_en: Not bringing the Certificate of Health Insurance Loss
common_mistakes.fix_en: The ward office cannot process your enrollment. Ask your former employer to issue this document.

after_submission.ja: 資格確認書を受け取ります
after_submission.en: You receive a qualification confirmation document (資格確認書) — keep this as proof of insurance

after_submission.ja: 保険料の通知が届きます
after_submission.en: Monthly premium notices arrive by mail. Pay at convenience stores, banks, or set up auto-debit

after_submission.ja: 扶養家族も同じ届出書で加入できます
after_submission.en: Dependents can be enrolled on the same form — list all household members

after_submission.ja: 保険料は前年の所得に基づいて計算されます
after_submission.en: Premiums are calculated based on your previous year's income
